stimulusHtml: In the interest of reviving classical Greco-Roman style, Renaissance architect Filippo Brunelleschiâ€™s plan for the Pazzi Chapel notably drew on features from other existing buildings, such as the
choicesHtml: symmetrical plan, horizontal entablatures, and loggia of the Palazzo Rucellai
open-air plan, elliptical shape, and arcades of the Colosseum (Flavian Amphitheater)
central plan, large dome, and oculus of the Pantheon
rectilinear plan, longitudinal nave, and clerestory of Santa Sabina
